Uses of Class
Block

    • Uses of Block in <Unnamed>

      Fields in <Unnamed> with type parameters of type Block 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Block> Tray.blocksList
      Represents the list of Blocks that this Tray configuration currently contains.
      private static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Block> Block.pool
      Represents the static pool of the Block instances in this application.
      Methods in <Unnamed> that return Block 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static Block Solver.createBlock(java.lang.String line)
      Scans through the given String, which must be in the format "ULrow ULcol LRrow LRcol", and returns the corresponding Block.
      Block Tray.getBlock(int blockIdx)
      Returns the Block with the given index from the list of Blocks that this Tray currently contains.
      static Block Block.getInstance(int row1, int col1, int row2, int col2)
      Returns a Block instance with the given endpoints from the static Block pool.
      static Block Block.getInstance(Point upperLeft, int width, int height)
      Returns a Block instance with the given upper left position, width and height from the static Block pool.
      Block Block.relocate(Point newUpperLeft)
      Returns the Block instance which would result from moving this Block to the given position.
      Methods in <Unnamed> with parameters of type Block 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Block.collidesWith(Block o)
      Checks whether there are any common Points shared by this Block and the given Block.
      boolean Tray.containsBlock(Block b)
      Checks whether the given Block is in this Tray.
      Method parameters in <Unnamed> with type arguments of type Block 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static boolean Solver.isDesiredConfiguration(Tray config, java.util.Collection<Block> desiredBlocks)
      Checks whether config contains all the Blocks defined in desiredBlocks.
      private static boolean Solver.solve(Tray initialTray, java.util.Collection<Block> desiredBlocks)
      This Solver will make two choices before it performs the search: Blank-wise search or block-wise search: if neither Solver.blankwiseOnly or Solver.blockwiseOnly is true, the Solver will choose block-wise search if the number of Blocks in initialTray is larger than the number of blank spots.
      Constructor parameters in <Unnamed> with type arguments of type Block 
      Constructor and Description
      Tray(int rowSize, int colSize, java.util.Collection<Block> blocks)
      Initializes an empty tray with the given dimensions and blocks, without checking whether there are any invalid or conflicting blocks.
